channel.title: This is my idea
channel.description: I don't know if its been said before or not, but if you get the urls to download the loader to a 'world' on runescape, which I have one, is it possiable you could do something to affect runescape through that, because I tried to set a bug in it, and it made ppl lag like crazy for awhile, but it didn't do much, I was wondering if anybody else would know how to use it to affect rs?

item.title: This is my idea
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

^^ That’s what I said.

Read full topic

item.title: This is my idea
item.dc:creator: @zstars zstars
item.description:
@zstars wrote:

There is no way to hide the IP of a server from a client, unless the real server is behind a proxy, which especially in the case of game servers makes no sense. You just have to CTRL+R -> “cmd” -> netstat while you are playing to see the IP of the game server you are connected to.

Also, you can’t crash or exploit the server more easily because of that fact. Why?
if(client.clientid == 0) {client.ban();}

Read full topic

item.title: This is my idea
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

No, when your connected to the server the only possible option you have is writing and reading to and from the socket. Even if there was a combination of bytes that could be written that would make the response indicate the gameServers adress, it would still have to be decoded.

Read full topic

item.title: This is my idea
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Jagex controls the login server. They physically own that server. The game worlds are not physically owned by Jagex, but are the intuitive property of their company. The game servers are hosted by other companies that specialize in that thing.

Read full topic

item.title: This is my idea
item.dc:creator: @Sleep Sleep
item.description:
@Sleep wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:3, topic:28558”]No, you’d have to find the IP of the game world themselves.

See, they have a login server, which acts as a barrier around the game worlds by limiting login requests and at the same time lightening its load. When you connect to RS, your just connecting to the login server, which verifies you then lets you connect to a game world. If you could find out the IP of a game world, you could probably start some serious shit.[/quote]

I agree with him… if you could get directly into the server… then we could recreate 6-6-6

Read full topic

item.title: This is my idea
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

Well, I started rs, and while it was loading, ( i cleared history and stuff and turned up security), and it asked permission to launch rs, and i got the link from the page because it was trying to load,
i went to the link, and it downloaded the characteristics of the world, like the loader and such, I though that I could do somethin with that?

Read full topic

item.title: This is my idea
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

No, you’d have to find the IP of the game world themselves.

See, they have a login server, which acts as a barrier around the game worlds by limiting login requests and at the same time lightening its load. When you connect to RS, your just connecting to the login server, which verifies you then lets you connect to a game world. If you could find out the IP of a game world, you could probably start some serious shit.

Read full topic
